intro: Micromeria graeca var. angustifolia-glabrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Greek micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a small shrub characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in botany and horticulture.
